sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'; const PregnancyCare = () => { const pregnancyStages = [ { title: 'Pre-pregnancy (Planning)', weeks: 'Before conception', keyPoints: [ 'Folic acid supplementation', 'Balanced nutrition', 'Regular exercise routine', 'Stress management practices', ], lifestyle: [ 'Quit smoking and alcohol', 'Regular prenatal check-ups', 'Healthy weight maintenance', 'Yoga and meditation', ], }, { title: 'First Trimester', weeks: 'Weeks 1-12', keyPoints: [ 'Morning sickness management', 'Crucial organ development', 'Dietary restrictions', 'Rest and self-care', ], lifestyle: [ 'Small, frequent meals', 'Ginger tea for nausea', 'Light exercises', 'Adequate sleep', ], }, { title: 'Second Trimester', weeks: 'Weeks 13-26', keyPoints: [ 'Baby movement begins', 'Energy levels improve', 'Weight gain monitoring', 'Regular exercise', ], lifestyle: [ 'Pregnancy yoga', 'Balanced nutrition', 'Regular walks', 'Birth preparation classes', ], }, { title: 'Third Trimester', weeks: 'Weeks 27-40', keyPoints: [ 'Frequent check-ups', 'Birth preparation', 'Monitoring baby position', 'Labor signs awareness', ], lifestyle: [ 'Pelvic floor exercises', 'Birth plan preparation', 'Hospital bag packing', 'Relaxation techniques', ], }, ]; const nutritionGuidelines = [ { category: 'Essential Nutrients', items: [ 'Iron-rich foods (spinach, dates, jaggery)', 'Calcium sources (dairy, sesame seeds)', 'Protein (lentils, nuts, eggs if non-vegetarian)', 'Folate-rich foods (green leafy vegetables)', ], }, { category: 'Traditional Superfoods', items: [ 'Ghee (clarified butter) for brain development', 'Saffron milk for immunity', 'Dry fruits and nuts mixture', 'Fresh fruits and vegetables', ], }, { category: 'Foods to Avoid', items: [ 'Raw or undercooked foods', 'Excess caffeine', 'High-mercury fish', 'Unpasteurized dairy products', ], }, ]; const epicReadingBenefits = [ { title: 'Ramayana Benefits', benefits: [ 'Stories of dharma (righteousness) and moral values', 'Positive energy and peaceful mindset', 'Understanding of ideal relationships', 'Cultural connection for the baby', ], }, { title: 'Mahabharata Benefits', benefits: [ 'Complex character studies for mental stimulation', 'Life lessons and wisdom', 'Strategic thinking development', 'Rich cultural heritage transmission', ], }, ]; return (

Pregnancy Care

{/* Pregnancy Stages Section */}

Stages of Pregnancy

{pregnancyStages.map((stage, index) => (

{stage.title}

{stage.weeks}

Key Points

    {stage.keyPoints.map((point, i) => (
  • {point}
    • ))}

Lifestyle & Care

    {stage.lifestyle.map((item, i) => (
  • {item}
    • ))}
))}
{/* Diet & Exercise Section */}

Diet & Exercise Guidelines

{/* Nutrition Guidelines */}

Nutrition Guidelines

{nutritionGuidelines.map((category, index) => (

{category.category}

    {category.items.map((item, i) => (
  • {item}
    • ))}
))}
{/* Exercise Guidelines */}

Safe Exercise Practices

Recommended Activities

  • Prenatal yoga
  • Walking (20-30 minutes daily)
  • Swimming
  • Pelvic floor exercises
  • Gentle stretching

Exercise Guidelines

  • Listen to your body
  • Stay hydrated
  • Avoid overheating
  • Stop if experiencing discomfort
  • Consult healthcare provider
{/* Indian Epic Reading Section */}

Benefits of Reading Indian Epics

According to traditional wisdom, reading sacred texts during pregnancy can positively influence the baby's development and create a peaceful environment for both mother and child.

{epicReadingBenefits.map((epic, index) => (

{epic.title}

    {epic.benefits.map((benefit, i) => (
  • {benefit}
    • ))}
))}

Reading Practice Tips

  • Set aside dedicated time daily
  • Read aloud to create a connection with baby
  • Discuss stories with family members
  • Reflect on the moral teachings
{/* Emotional Support Section */}

Emotional & Mental Support

Building Support Network

  • Share feelings with partner and family
  • Join pregnancy support groups
  • Connect with other expectant mothers
  • Regular communication with healthcare providers

Self-Care Practices

  • Practice meditation and mindfulness
  • Maintain a pregnancy journal
  • Engage in creative activities
  • Spend time in nature

Managing Emotional Changes

  • Acknowledge mood swings as normal
  • Practice relaxation techniques
  • Seek professional help if needed
  • Maintain open communication
); }; export default PregnancyCare;
